It picked up all this fine dirt and dog hair AFTER, A-F-T-E-R the Dyson and the Bissel. The pictures I posted are dirt and dog hair that the Dyson and the Bissel could not pick up.
Great vacuum. I use it on both of my shag rugs and my hard floors, it performs beautifully on both and it's super east to take apart. The filter is easy to clean. 10/10 would buy again.

This vacuum has exceed my expectation.  The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 star rating was because I wish it was a little lighter.  Otherwise, it's great!  It really pulls up the dirt from hardwood floors and carpeted.  It's easy to move and it gets in awkward spaces with the unique rotation.

This vacuum does a very good job with suction both on floor and with hose. HOWEVER, the hose keeps coming unattached! When I'm using it to vacuum baseboards, the hose connection to the vacuum turns and it comes undone almost every 30 seconds. The hose also does not extend very well. I can get it to extend about 3 feet before the vacuum just pulls along with it.
Very powerful, easy to use, nice features like retractable cord and bagless collection system. My favorite vacuum cleaner of all time.
great machine and very happy. After 6mo trouble began. Cord does not stay out and today machine stopped running completely- now what?

My first one did not have the rewind feature. Now, I'm very rough on vacuums -- I own 6 dogs who like to chew toweling and kleenex. I go thru vacuums at least every 6 months. I've had Dyson, Orecks,
Dirt Devils, you name it. I've spent from $70 to 600. My Dyson is sitting in my basement -- it lasted a few months. Can't figure out how to unplug it, so i gave up. I will never buy another expensive vacuum again. The oreck is nice and light and works well, when it works. it's been in the shop more than at my home, so I gave up on it too.
My last wind tunnel just stopped working. I had half of the living room vacuumed and POOF it just stopped. I waited awhile and it worked for 5 minutes then stopped. It's now out by the trash can.
I just bought this one. I expect it to last a few months, but at the price, I'm not overly upset. It's my lot in life...lol

This review is to note that is you have the model WITH the brush on/off switch (turn off the brush for hardwood floors), you need to order the belt with the part number AH20065. I don't know why it makes a difference, but according to the owner's manual, it's the type you're supposed to get. Not easy to find on Amazon or Hoover's site. The belt # 38528058/AH20080 is for the wind tunnel WITHOUT THE brush on/off feature.

This model has good suction. It doesn't blow back dirt at your feet. It's not perfect. If anyone has a vacuum that can withstand 6 dogs for any length of time, please let me know. I seem to have become a vacuum collector.

updated 12/28/10: So far since I bought this (11/10), the belt has become dislodged twice. No tools needed to open up the bottom, but it's a royal pain to get the belt back into place. I'm not happy with it at all. It shouldn't dislodge this often. Ordering the Bissell today. This one is sitting there waiting for me to operate on the belt again...when I have time. I would not recommend it any longer.

The vacuum worked very well for almost 4 years, then the brush roll stopped turning permanently. Knowing there was a 5 year warranty reach out to Shark support and did a video troubleshooting session with them. Turns out the base is not covered this long and requires me to pay for a new one. Probably better to just buy a new machine altogether. Disappointing.

It's so nice, it's so powerful, the anti hair wrap feature Does work, the lift away function is quite handy and the provided attachments are extremely useful. I would recommend this vacuum to anyone that hates vacuuming as it could very well change your mind!
The shark is better than the dyson and cheaper great bang for the buck, the wife loves it !!! It's easy to use with all the attachments
Iâ€™ve owned this for 3 months. Used it maybe 12xâ€¦ Iâ€™m sick of having to charge after every session and my house isnâ€™t very big!

We were pleasantly surprised how lightweight and easy to use This vacuum cleaner is. We have three animals in the house and it has always been a challenge to find a vacuum cleaner that doesn't get clogged up especially around the brush. The brush on this vacuum cleaner does not get clogged up and it works great. A really nice product for the money

Hardwood floors are a pain to keep clean but it is easier with this nee floor mate from hoover that helps you keep the floor clean and dry and free of pesky dust-mites. Has multiple settings, easy to set up and easier to use.

Iâ€™ve had my breeze for a little over a month now. I found it easy to put together. However, I was using it and it started to smoke and smell like plastic melting. I stopped it to see if I had accidentally sucked anything up.... I was wrong. Belt started malfunctioning and was ripping apart the inside brush and plastic. Googled it to see if it was common and found it, along with tons of other dirt devil items mostly sold on amazon have been recalled. So please use caution.

This vacuum is very heavy and hard to use. It is difficult to push and It doesn't suck anything within 4 inches from the wall so you have to remove the hose and then vacuum all over again. The cheap $50 ones from Walmart work better than this. The only bonus is that I get a workout just trying to vacuum my rugs. Do not recommend
This is a fantastic vacuum! I've wanted a Dyson for years and glad I finally got one. It cleans both carpet and hard surfaces very well, empties easily and is very maneuverable.

No clogs and motor smelt like burnt plastic. When first purchased I was satisfied. Loss suction overtime which ultimately died. I had a Shark Duo clean for years and no problems. Seems that the material is cheaper.

Hoover makes a solid, well-made vacuum. It is sturdy with quality parts. It is easy to maneuver. The one/off and power setting switch (low, medium, high) is located at the top of the handle; however, I find myself occasionally turning off the vacuum by accident. I wish the power button were a few more inches away from my hand. This is a minor and perhaps personal issue but thought I'd mention it.

The vacuum has very good suction which corresponds to the setting you choose. The higher the suction setting, the less battery time you'll have. I wish you could charge the battery without having to remove it.

Overall, for bare floors and low pile carpet, this vacuum does a decent job. At 10lbs, it's a bit heavy for stairs but doable. Overall its a quality vacuum but it cannot replace the need for a full upright as there are no tools to attach.

This will work great for "just made" messes, it does not clean good on set in messes. Example, spilled milk ( I have toddlers with cups that leak little drops) if you let it dry, it will not clean it all the way off. I expected more for this price and the rant and raves over this mop..

It's very powerful but my old professional model shark is better in many ways. This one doesn't have a very long cord, no headlight, no bare floor tool and the dirt cup is significantly smaller. It's not as substantial either. Granted it's less money. On the flip side, the brush roller doesn't collect hair. It's very powerful and does the job for now. I do worry about the hose holding up because it's not as thick as my old shark which is the reason I had to purchase this one. All in all its good but I feel like I went from a Cadillac to a Corolla.

The top handle piece of the vacuum I received (when you press the button to release) is obviously defective. Every time I try pushing the vacuum around and I have to pull on it, it comes disconnected. I am happy overall in the performance but think itâ€™s needs a new hose and handle part and the metal pole part that it locks into.
Love the dirt suction power.  Just wish the hose was longer and the beater brush could be shut off when using accessories.
I bought this in September of 2021 Didnâ€™t open box until this year 2022. It quit working in three months. Will never buy again

I just traded up my Hoover for this Shark Pro Navigator. One of the main reasons I chose the PRO as opposed to the regular Navigator is because of the bigger canister. We have a Golden Retriever with a lot of hair, so a bigger canister is a must.

PROS: It seems to have really great suction power. I love the versatility that I can take this from a stand up vacuum to a canister vacuum for the stairs, to a hard floor cleaner. I love the swivel function to fit around curved space. It's not nearly as noisy as my old vacuum. This thing has a ton of filters that are washable.

CONS: It feels like one of the cheaper infomercial products. Before everyone gets upset that I said that, I just mean it doesn't feel as sturdy as any of the other vacuums I've had in the past. The actual vacuum head seems TINY compared to any vacuum I've had in the past. If I were vacuuming a small apartment, fine. But 5 bedrooms and 3 floors? Sort of a "fail" there.

I have had a Dyson in the past, and I don't think this would compare with a Dyson. Dysons are sturdier, and more of a quality stand up vacuum. This vacuum is great in other ways, like the break down functions, and bare floor functions. (I'm not a fan of Dyson bc mine broke after 2 years, so I didn't find the 500$ price tag worth it).

I would give this one between a 3 and 4 stars...

nothing work after after few days!!! i was a bissel client i changed to hoover to try their products. It was wonderful! the first day I thought i would recommend this to everyone. I found it easy to use and worked miracles but when try to use it again nothing work it is defective product i called hoover they send me to the vacuum factory i changed the city and let that machine with them long time, when i m back and use it as a dry option only it stopped working the dry option stop while i m only cleaning the kitchen nothing else i paid this amount and bought this machine for all my house but cause i m taking care of it i only use it in the kitchen one time per 10 days or a month, i have the brush new cause i was using other mop to clean the kitchen i only use this machine for drying only and few times and only in kitchen but it stopped working i never felt happy after that believe me if i said this machine make me sad cause i kept taking care of it but it is from the beginning a defective one they cheaters me and refuse to replace it not from the beginning not after warranty, i got a defective mop from bissell they changed immediately and send me a voucher to buy new one cause they know their item and trust client here no trust at all they live you with a defective product and 100 emails sent to hoover they don't care about their client it is the worst customer service ever they will not replace it so save your money and be aware of buying this product and dealing with them i m super sad i only use this in kitchen i don't have lots of mess no pets too but this company make me sad

After receiving, assembling and reading the directions I used it for 15 minutes. It was incredible, picking up cat hair on carpet and hardwood floor. But, the link between the handle and wand in the core of the machine was plastic and it fell apart, making it unable to use. I called the manufacturer directly, and found out they were still tracking down this model because they had had to reengineer the problem. I havenâ€™t got my replacement yet, but am hoping it will stay together, as itâ€™s a great suction machine. I suggest buying directly from Hoover to avoid old inventory and filling out their warranty. The machine is only as strong as itâ€™s weakest parts, and I got a reject. Am hoping it will live up to my expectations.
There is only height. Very hard to push on carpet. Easy to push on hard floors. Iâ€™m very unhappy with it.

Belt broke within 5 minutes of initial use. Hoover said they were sending 5 new ones. After 3 weeks, I received 2.
Attachment hose way too short.

This is a great vacuum for the money.  It has lots of vacuuming power like the other reviewers claimed which is nice because it picked up as much as my Shark for half the price.  A couple things I didn't like about it was that I'd like for it to have had a light on front like my Shark used to but that's not the reason for the 4 stars.  The reason for it is that where the dirt canister meets the vacuum seems like it's not secure enough and can foresee encountering problems in the future with dirt escaping through there quite easily ðŸ˜ for now it's doing very well but I'll probably go back to Shark after this.

Well what can I say, bought another Dyson. My last Dyson lasted 16+ years the best Iâ€™ve ever owned. Always had pets, kitties & doggies. This Dyson called â€œanimalâ€ is fitting, it actually pulls you along because the suction is so strong! So when you first get it and put it together, donâ€™t be concerned because it seems so heavy once this beast is turned on it works itâ€™s magic best vacuum Iâ€™ve ever had hands-down!

1) Lightweight - I get easily fatigued and while I have always loved my Shark vacuums, they are sometimes heavy for me. I needed something lightweight since we recently moved into a home with carpeted stairs. This is PERFECT.

2) Pickup - I'm not going to lie...we NEEDED to vacuum. We moved and lost our vacuum in the move so we went a month without owning a vacuum. We have 2 beagles, 2 cats, and 3 kids. AND we live in the forest so debris does come in the door pretty easily. I felt like Snow White using it for the first time because it was working miracles!!

3) Storage - If you have read this far, you saw I recently moved. This was a situation of downsizing. We were in 3700 sqft and now 1700 and there are 5 of us plus 4 pets. Storage is limited now and storing a large vacuum isn't something I wanted to waste space on, so this is perfect for that. The handheld hooks to the front which makes it shorter to store as well. A smaller footprint all around.

4) Hair - Hair does not get caught. At least until it hits the filter then it wraps around for easy cleanout. I have long hair as does my daughter, so this is a necessity. We've really tested it since it arrived and I am impressed. As far as pet hair, it picks up so well that my tan carpeted steps now look IVORY.

5) FIVE STARS - Can't wait to tell everyone I know about this vacuum!! Hope this review helps someone.

I got this & didn't use right away, boy I should of. This is junk. My 1st time using the handle broke off top tank, then attachments didn't work & just ran out bottom. I thought u could trust Hoover but this is so cheaply made & I was so sad that it didn't work. Hoover's warrenties is a nightmare so I lost all my money for a product that don't work, links, handle broke 1st use its made so cheap. Then cleaning it up was even worse. Don't waste ur money!!!

I was one of the ones who jumped on the band wagon of how great this vacuum was. Learn my lesson and from now on I don't do a review until it has been tested over time. In this case, time showed me how quickly this vacuum quality held up and it was not good. I'm now in the market for another Vac.

This vacuum has good suction, but it is very hard to use.  The cord seems always to be in the way, the on/off switch is very hard to get to, and the thing is HEAVY!  I was looking for an upright to use daily in my sewing/craft room, but this is just too heavy for daily use.

Terrible!  I have purchased 4 of these during the last 8 years or so.....Each one last alittle less than the previous.  This one only lasted 9 months (using 2x month for an hour or so) and the unit will not dispense soap anymore.  Other units all break at about 18 months, which is kinda ok with me.  This unit will eventually break down for various reasons, BUT 9 MONTHS!

I've been using this vacuum for about 4 months, and really like it so far. It is awesome for sucking up pet hair, sand, and general day to day dirt (we leave near the beach, and have a cat, so that can be a lot in our household!) It's not terribly heavy, but is an upright, so might be a bit too much weight if you don't want to lug around a the entire weight of the vacuum everywhere you go. It's also easy to dump the canister (although do this carefully as we dumped it out all over the newly vacuumed floor the first time!) I still keep my old featherlight vaccuum though for the stairs, as this one is a bit challenging to manuever up and down a long flight of stairs, even using the attachments.

I had the Dyson Animal for years and it was awesome. This is a pain to use and not worth the money. Suction is not that great and to use the extender hose, you have stop and take things apart and put together. With the animal model, you just pull it out and start using it. So disappointed in this model. Would not recommend that you spend this kind of money on this model.

I bought this vacuum in April I have not even had it a year and the past two months it has spit out dirt and will not suck anything up. I have unhooked valve and cleaned thoroughly. I have also cleaned the filters. I am saddened this has happened. The same thing happened with the Shark vacuum I bought before this one and I was hoping to give them another chance. If there is anyway to fix this issue I would like to be notified.

Had a bagless Bissell for 10 years...great vacuum but motor started getting loud.  Bought this one and I'm very impressed...very quiet and very strong.  We had just vacuumed about 2 days before this arrived...unboxed it, very easy to put together, and gave it a test run.  Dogs didn't even run and hide cause it was so quiet....and I was amazed how much hair and dirt it picked up since the carpet was just vacuumed 2 days earlier.  Hope it lasts but so far I'm very impressed and the price is fantastic.

Very impressed with this vacuum! It is lightweight, and has very powerful suction! On certain carpeting you can actually see it lifting a little. My carpeting looks like new again, and I was shocked to see how much dirt it picked up, considering I had just used my old vacuum the same day beforehand.

My only complaint is the hassle of having to turn it off, bend down and transfer the hose from "1" floor mode, to "2" tool mode. But I did see this prior to purchase so I can't complain!

This thing is HEAVY. So heavy that I had to truly lean into pushing it back and forth across the rug. The tools that come with it are laughable and basically useless.
I does have a large canister, which is probably the only redeeming quality.

I received my vacuum 4 days ago. I have been a Die Hard Dyson Fan because of my dog and cat, wood stove, adult kids and an adult husband that never take their shoes off! My husband and I watched an infomercial about the Shark...and we both agreed that the biggest downfall that we have noticed with the Dyson is their less than convenient hose...it is really cumbersome because it really isn't flexible...therefore, it never gets used! After some Amazon research, I decided that the model on TV wasn't what I really wanted! I had to have this sporty looking one with a bigger motor!
I had vacuumed with the Dyson before unboxing the Shark. I had vacuumed the usual dog/cat hair and all the other crud up and the carpet looked good...I thought! I unboxed the Shark and just had to see if it would have anything to pick up after just vacuuming! I could not believe that this vacuum actually sucked as hard as it does and the hair and dirt that I couldn't even see filled the canister! My carpet looks and feels so much better! I love the flexible hose on it...way better than the Dyson! If this vacuum holds up as well as my Dyson's have...I will be purchasing one for both of my daughters for Christmas!

The bissell cleanview compact upright vacuum was amazing, until day 90. The motor stopped working. The brush stopped moving and the motor started smoking and smelled very bad, I'm sure y'all know what I mean. ItÂ did a great job picking up kitty litter and cat hair till the motor burned out. I did clean the brush bar of hair every few vacuums and cleaned the filter also. Not sure why the motor burned out after so little time. I can't return it and I don't have a car or much extra $ to take a uber to a repair shop so I guess I'll just have a dirty house till I can buy another vacuum. Really bummed out because I liked this vacuum a lot.

Never owned a vacuum cleaner before that required a total disassembly and use of a Shop Vac to keep it clean and functioning. I'm used to vacuums that required the bag and filter be replaced and THAT usually took only a few minutes to accomplish. Not this baby! When it works it works great, but otherwise it's asthmatic at best.

I LOVE my new Hoover Tempo! It's a great little vacuum. For many years I've been using 'better' models, but no more. I've had problems with them all over the almost 30 years I've been a wife and mother, and after buying this model for my son and daughter-in-law a few months ago (and they LOVE their's) I decided to buy myself one. It has great suction, and is lightweight and easy for me to maneuver and carry around.

My only criticisms are... I wish the electrical cord was about twice as long, and that the hose was made of a bit beefier plastic...but both are very livable as is.
We like it so far.  It really sucks!  That's good for a vacuum.  The brush wants to pull the vacuum along and really seems to get up the dirt.  It's solid.  The hose could be a little longer.

It does a good job but the on/off switch broke after 2 years and it was going to cost $120 to fix it. So we had to pull the plug out of the wall to turn it off.

Then it started overheating after 4 years and it was going to cost another $120 to fix that. The hepa filter was $50. It is also heavy, my petite wife needed me to move upstairs when she wanted to use it.

I bought the dyson Animal vaccum about 2 years ago now and I don't know if I would spend this much on a vaccum again. I have had to take it in to be professionally cleaned at least once a year. The first time I did that the Dyson approved dealer told me there was no difference betweent the animal version (purple- and the one I have) and the normal version (yellow and about $100 cheaper). He said they used the same parts and did the same thing. The suction is great when it is fully operational, but for the money we paid for the vaccum, I wouldn't expect all the follow up to ensure optimal performance.

I used my vacuum for the first time today and Iâ€™m super disappointed. The suction does suck simple things on the ground shouldâ€™ve been very easy to pick up like the little fly away is it fly off of Styrofoam. The Thing that sucks your cord back in I had to hit about five or six times before it even sucked the cord back in definitely NOT worth the money! I open the box and put it together on Sunday and today is Wednesday I already threw the box away or else I would be returning this!

Positives-
This unit collects very well.
There are very good filters.
Its filter's collect a lot of nose sneezing dust.
It is a very light unit compared to competition with the same suck strength.
It has easy access for changing filters and belts.
Negitive-
It does not have a light on it that was great for the dark areas when I owned a classic windtunnel.

I love this vacuum more than any other cleaning supplies in my home. I had been using a $40.00 Dirt Devil vacuum that my man insisted we get over this vacuum that I wanted. He was the champion of saying we were only paying more money for the name brand even though I told him he was wrong. Anyways he was using the vacuum and said â€œthis sucks and picks up nothingâ€ so I said â€œhmm, maybe buy the vacuum I wanted.â€ Needless to say I have the vacuum I wanted and I got to say â€œI told you soâ€ which made my day fabulous. I have converted him, and he now knows that Hoover is superior.

We like the actual vacuum itself very much. Unfortunately, the battery died / went defective (would no longer charge) within 5 months of purchase. I've been working with Hoover for the manufacturer warranty and they've been trying to sent me a replacement battery for 2 months now.

The batteries have been backordered at their warehouse this entire time (but yet have been available at Amazon the whole time as well) which either tells you sometime about the quality of the product or that they're just simply selling the product instead of retaining parts as needed for warranty issues.

If the battery lasted a year or two I'd give it 5 stars, but 5 months with a useless manufacturers warranty is pathetic.

Hand tool extremely loud high pitch noise, sent my dogs into a frenzy knocking everything over. The brush does not do a good job of brushing out debris from carpets. Good suction power. Vacuum does not stand well on its own. It will fall over when using hose. To prevent vacuum from falling over, you must detach it from the base to carry around. It was fine but it got to be too heavy and cumbersome. Would not recommend buying if you have pets or carpets.

DO NOT ORDER THIS PRODUCT!  Iâ€™ve had it for 8 months and have wanted to toss it more than once.  I vacuum once every few weeks because as a flight attendant, Iâ€™m only home about 10 days a month.  Today, Iâ€™ve had it!  Does not suck up but blows out, runs hot and automatically shuts off before I even finish vacuuming my tiny living room.  SAVE YOUR MONEY!

It is an awesome vac. I had been using a shopvac, due to having so much hardwood floor, and I used this vac on a large area rug (that got vacuummed @every day) and it pulled almost half a container of dirt and hair out.
vacuum itself is great. the pet power brush is a complete joke. put it on, switched to hardfloor setting, vacuumed 3 steps and it stopped spinning. JUNK!
The cord on this broke right after the return policy expired.  Now it is an electrical issue and because it had to be wrapped you can curl up the cord anymore. Never buy it again

We've had this for 2 months. We have one German Shepard. The hair builds up around the belt immediately and then the brush stops spinning. We have to clean it out constantly and the belt has already broken once. When it works, it's amazing.

I did not realize just how much our ES sheds.  With the vacuum I previously used, the debris was concealed in a disposable vacuum bag.  With this vacuum, you see the vast amount of hair and other debris gathered in the canister.  It is definitely quieter than my previous vacuum and seems to do a great job in cleaning the floors.  No complaints here.

My first order came fast, but it had a problem with the foot brush roll. I contacted with Shark customer service and received a good support. They replaced foot brush roll fast. Unfortunately it didn't work. It seemed to me vacuum cleaner had some electronic  contacts problem. I returned product and got a full refund right way. I was disappointed but decided to give a second chance to Shark. I went to the local store Sears and got a same vacuum cleaner. I love it! It's really powerful, maneuver, light and easy to use. My 8 years old daughter finally can vacuum by herself and she really likes it. The product is excellent, shipping was fast, customer service great.

There are pros and cons with this vacuum.

The worst part about it is the Hush mode. I purchased it so I could vacuum above my second story neighbor every day without all of the noise. Wrong. The hush mode does not sound that much different than the regular vacuum mode. Bummer for me.

The vacuum cleaner is quite heavy for a 105 pound person (especially going upstairs with it). Also, the front of the vacuum cleaner is wide so it did not fit between chairs etc. in my small condo space. It would be great for a large home or condo with a large area to vacuum.

The good points are that it has a super long cord, it does pick up a lot of cat/dog hair and the bagless system is easy to empty.

In the future I would go to the store to pick a vacuum instead of ordering one on-line without seeing it , hearing the sound and picking it up. My bad. : )
Great vacuum for the price!! Big canister. Picks up tonssss of dog hair. Pet attachment works well. Only had for a few days but so far itâ€™s worth the price

It doesnt pick up anything. I bought it over a year ago for my son when he moves out. He moved out few months ago and the vacuum doesnt pick up anything. It is brand new but unfortunately we had it over a year so we cannot return. Tried to trouble shoot and no luck. We are dragging my dyson to his house to vacuum. Expert support is not available due to time passed. If seller is reading this, please help. Would love to get it to work and change my rating.
